intro: Crassothonna, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. Crassothonna species typically have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers range in color from yellow to orange. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
